results.title: Be well: physical fitness in the later years
results.brief_description: This film shows a variety of ways in which older people can stay physically active, or even start exercising regularly for the first time in their lives. Seniors who have incorporated such physical activities into their daily routines are living proof of the rewards.

results.title: Battlefield pilot
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Australian Army pilots are among the best low level fliers in the world. The film demonstrates their skill by observing in depth a low level training flight by an Army pilot in a Pilatus Porter aircraft.

results.title: Battle scars: an overview of our defence against disease
results.creator_credit: Bob Hardie, East Australian Film Corporation and VEA
results.brief_description: This program investigates the Human immune system and what defences the human body has against disease. Topics covered in this area include: physical barriers against disease, means of pathogenic entry into the body, defences of the body against entry of pathogens, antigens and antibodies, role of phagocytes, the immune system and its function, the nature of immunity, vaccines and their development and the function of antibiotics.
results.title_for_label: Battle scars: an overview of our defence against disease
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Hardie, East Australian Film Corporation and VEA

results.title: Battle of the road
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Hugh Alexander, Australian National Film Board and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: Begins by showing the destruction of human life in wartime from modern weapons of war, and then stresses the need to prevent “the battle of the roads” which causes comparable casualties in peace time. The film points out common driving mistakes made by motorists, and shows how the carelessness of pedestrians also causes many accidents. The effects of speed upon the time to brake cars is shown. The huge loss of production each year and the heavy financial burden on the nation due to accidents is emphasised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy, Hugh Alexander, Australian National Film Board and Australian Road Safety Council

results.title: Bathtime
results.creator_credit: Peter Madden, David Atkinson, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A humourous claymation where a woman after waking in the morning takes a bath going through her morning cleansing ritual before work. The partner only later wakes up to find the woman missing.

results.title: Bathing the patient (home care)
results.creator_credit: Marian Evans, F.E. Brooker, Ted Nemeth Studios and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A guide to the home care of that maimed and injured loved one, recently returned from that dust-up in the Pacific. Solemn tone betrays not the least sympathy for the invalided one. In the absence of emotion, the domestic environment becomes a place of chilling austerity. Dutiful wife seeming resigned to her fate as resentful attendant. Frightening for its utilitarian ommissions. United States Office of Education training film for use in the instruction of professional nurses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marian Evans, F.E. Brooker, Ted Nemeth Studios and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids

results.title: Basketball for girls [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This film shows basketball as a game of skill, based on cooperative team play. It is presented in eleven sequences to enable discussion and clarification of the points in each. A short description of the game follows, then particular aspects are fully explained and demonstrated. Common faults are shown and the necessity for regular practice of court system is stressed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
